6.20.17  1:28 pm   Which one of these is the most correct interpretation of your creative process for making long videos? 1. research - narration - vocal melodies - chords - graphics 2. research - narration - chords - vocal melodies - graphics 3. research - narration - graphics - chords - vocal melodies 4. Just feel it, man. Fuck the process. 5. Listen to more records, close the Real Book.

      it's more like write/research/write (including writing the exact notes and chords of all the parts with singing).... phase 2 is make a plan for how to execute the thing and gather all the elements needed.... then record a temp narration with proper timing including any singing... then build the actual visuals over that.... then record the final narration... re-allign the timing of the graphics to fit the new narration.... record the final music and vocals for the parts with singing.... then finally do all the other instrumental music and sounds that fills the rest of the video.... then start doing troubleshooting lists and fixing everything on the list until you have smaller and smaller lists until the things to fix are so small that you don't care

6.20.17  1:09 pm   what do you think of this idea for more time for you to do songs?

     given the amount of songs to do, i think it's important to put them out every week. what's more is, given the huge amount of other things to do (such as videos, and much more) it is also important to condense the song production time to much less than a week, to have sufficient time to get anything else done. but i am a long way from making this a reality. i don't really know what to do. one of my best days recently was last monday when i divided up the day between working on a new video, collecting clips for the next reality update, collecting notes for a notes update, managing various social media platforms, writing tweets, answering emails, ... it was a wonderfully well rounded and productive day. but as a result, that set me back a day on the song schedule and the later part of the week was big panic time and i barely managed to finish the song on time. this week will be worse, and there will be absolutely no time for anything except the song. i don't really know what i'm going to do

6.19.17  1:21 pm   I was going through the reality section and I found that after the history of japan video from last year you just suddenly stopped making any of the reality videos. was it because you were too focused on getting the other videos out, and eventually, HOTEWIG? or was it because of something else?

     that's not quite how it went. instead of suddenly 'stopping' after history of japan, i suddenly Started after history of japan. the reality page never existed before that. after releasing history of japan i thought it would be a good chance to do what i've wanted to do for years, which is actually go through those thousands of hours of journals and edit them into something watchable, that shows what my life is like. it took about 3 months of solid work (feb-may, 2016) to collect and edit all those clips and make videos out of them. all other projects were put on hold in order to do those reality videos. everyone thought i was dead. finally i rushed through the last 2 years of the project and skipped out on huge sections of time, just to finish it around may 2016, and finally move on to more exciting newer content. by that time, there were also 3 new months of journals, mostly talking about editing journals of course. but i decided to save that for the next update, whenever i get a chance to put my career on hold again for 3 months. which is ironically what everyone thinks i'm always doing, because i can't make everyone's favorite type of content at the same time. for example, now i am doing songs every week. which is great news for all the people who wanted me to do songs while i was trying to do the reality videos. but unfortunately it is bad news for you. either way it is bad news for me, because i want all of it to be done immediately. i hope that makes sense

6.19.17  12:13 am   hallo! I wanted to ask you about I's, as I don't run into many other people who do not follow the capitalization guidelines just as they are given. I capitalize names as a measure of respect, and I consider I to be a name (your name for yourself when you are conveying yourself to someone else) but with how often I's turn up in text, it can feel self centered to capitalize it so often. do you think I should consider changing my policy?

     there are many reasons why i like to leave the i lowercase. 1. it seems a bit more humble 2. it seems more casual 3. it is less pretentious 4. capital i looks exactly like a different letter 5. a lower case i is much more personal and has more personality because it has an eye
